alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 10:16PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM MDT... At 1015 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Ranchvale to Saint Vrain. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Farwell, Texico, Saint Vrain, Cannon Air Force Base, Ranchvale, Arch, Oasis State Park, Portair, and Pleasant Hill. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 370 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for east central New Mexico.
